website_summaries.verdict: The colorful gears in this set really capture toddlers' attention, and the base plates can be built flat or in 3-dimensional shapes.
pros: 6 largest gears have stickers that look more intriguing with motion
Comes with a variety of gear sizes, axles and crank
Square base pieces easily interlock in flat or 3D formation
cons: Plastic prongs used to connect pieces can break, so be sure to use them gently

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy parts, great for toddlers
customer_reviews.text: We bought these for our 3 year old 4 months ago, and happily all of the pieces have held up well. These are very entertaining even for us parents and are great for learning colors and developing gross and fine motor skills. The white base pieces are a little difficult for little hands to push together, but that's okay by me because they don't slip apart while playing with them.
customer_reviews.author: m.gizewski

customer_reviews.title: They have four prongs which are very delicate and break off easily. After a few years' occasional use I had ...
customer_reviews.text: I already had a set of these and bought an additional set because of the weakness of the pieces which hold the gears onto the bases. They have four prongs which are very delicate and break off easily. After a few years' occasional use I had only two (of 24) left. The new set has held up better, but three of the four prongs which hold the crank onto a gear have also broken. They should sell these more delicate parts separately so you can replace them rather than having to buy an entire new set. I won't buy another.
customer_reviews.author: Donna M.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent toy with one drawback
customer_reviews.text: This toy was purchased as a Christmas present for a 3-year-old granddaughter. It is an excellent gears-type toy with beautiful pieces that work very smoothly together. The turning mechanism is easy to use and the colorful designs look gorgeous when the gears are turning. A variety of configurations are possible, adding to the play value. The one drawback is that each circular gear has 4 tiny prongs that must be lined up with 4 tiny holes on a base piece. Sometimes the 3-year-old was able to place the gears successfully but more often than not she required help. Despite this problem, this toy is fun for adults and children alike and invites exploration and experimentation.
customer_reviews.author: bam

customer_reviews.title: Great little stocking stuffer.....
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for the grandchildren for Christmas. When we were little, we had one that wasn't nearly as fancy, but it still makes young minds THINK! When I was in High School, it was mandatory to take an Air Force test prior to graduation. One section was all about gears, and thinking about which way each one would be turning. I aced the Air Force test......especially the mechanical part.....not too shabby for a *gurl* LOL! I want my grandchildren to do more creative, critical thinking. This is such a fun way to encourage it. I have given these to others in the past, and the funny thing is, even grownups have a blast with them! They definitely encourage *quality* time.
customer_reviews.author: Mairi

customer_reviews.title: Purchased for a 20 month old great nephew and he loved it
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a 20 month old great nephew and he loved it. He was able to put the pieces together by himself and he understood the concept of making it all work together. He played with it no stop constantly rearranging the gears and turning the crank; even his older brother (8) paused a few minutes to play with it. Its a small kit and more tiles and gears would have been a bonus but for a starter pack it was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Lori L. Considine

customer_reviews.title: Captivates Kids
customer_reviews.text: This is a toy that entertained a group of kids for hours as they turned the gears and rearranged the pieces. Only two small issues: The handle had a tendency to fall off as it was turned. Also, the user must fit the gears into the base by pushing four pegs into the holes in the white pegboard-style base. This required a bit of adult help. The pegs are thin enough that I can imagine kids eventually bending and breaking them. In fact, several extra mounting pieces are included, so it seems like this is anticipated by the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny B.

customer_reviews.title: Great product. My almost 3-year grandson caught on fairly ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product. My almost 3-year grandson caught on fairly quickly, but still needed help getting some gears placed correctly. I do wish it had more than one handle as I don't think the prongs will last long.
customer_reviews.author: karen w

customer_reviews.title: I loved the idea
customer_reviews.text: I loved the idea, but it didn't hold my daughters attention. However, I know other kids who would totally love it. It's a too each their own type toy. Those who love it will really love it, others will just ignore it. Personally, it was kind of fun to watch, but I can't imagine a 3 year old putting the gears into the white base board (b/c it was kind of tricky to alleign the pegs up when you couldn't see under the gears).
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth J. Buck

customer_reviews.title: Assembly too difficult for a toddler
customer_reviews.text: I bought this when my son was barely 2 and he wasn't at all interested. Now that he's almost 3 he enjoys it, but he still can't put the gears onto the base by himself. They have four little prongs and if the gear is already attached you can't see the holes to stick it it. I have trouble with it. The frustration factor is way too high for him to play with it alone. He enjoys snapping the base pieces together though and watching the gears spin. If I could do it again I think I would get a different gear set. This is just too hard to construct for a toddler.
customer_reviews.author: Madana

customer_reviews.title: Stem in the kitchen
customer_reviews.text: My son kices this gear, colorful and durable. It falls all the time fron our ref and we step on it and the magnet still work. Just a lot to clean up whe they are all over the place when your toddler puts them everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Christie Aying

customer_reviews.title: Great for little engineers
customer_reviews.text: We gave this to our 3 year old son for Christmas. His eyes lit up with possibilities as soon as he opened it! He's engineer minded and loves figuring out how things work and go together. This toy allows him to explore that desire while he plays. I love the quality and vivid colors and that this company manufactures it's products in Europe (Italy).
customer_reviews.author: BoSheep

customer_reviews.title: Nice toy
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice gear set and they allow a lot of different configurations. I am a little dissapointed that the plastic pieces that hold the gears the gears are held together by friction; they don't actually interlock. This is good for young, small hands but because they don't truly interlock, they flex a little too much for me. For this reason, they are better assembled on a hard, flat surface rather than on a carpeted floor. They are carefully molded and the gears spin freely on their "hubs" so they work well even with long assemblies of many gears. Overall I am satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: R. Best

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: This toy is highly education and is of superb quality. My son is 3 and he is able to manipulate the pieces without any help. There are limitations to what this toy can do when compared with the traditional blocks because of its varying sizes, shapes and edges. However, my son is not fond of blocks, so he is sort of mesmerized by this. Since there are a lot of pieces of different size, I find storage to be a pain. There are extra pieces of the small white connectors which is good since the toy would be useless without them.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Fun and educational for wide range of age groups
customer_reviews.text: My 4 year old daughter received this for Christmas and she loves it - as do her parents. We didn't find the pieces difficult to assemble. It's true that it's challenging for a 4 year old, but it's a toy that my child can grow with, and that she can continue to explore and find new ways to understand for many years to come. It looks durable, but we've only had it a little over a week. For the 4-5 year old age group, parents can expect to render a little assistance, but they'll probably think it's fun, too. Here's another unexpected plus: it's made in Italy.
customer_reviews.author: UCF Professor

customer_reviews.title: Super Cool!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this set for my 2 1/2 year old granddaughter, who loves to take apart and put together items. It is a little advanced for her right now...but her daddy had a terrific time playing with it on Christmas morning. My granddaughter has her daddy's mechanical skills and her small motor skills are quite advanced for her age. I know that she will have it figured out in no time...and will love playing with it...that is, IF she can get it away from her daddy! :P
customer_reviews.author: Grandma with her cell phone!

customer_reviews.title: Added to the Tech Set and now its more fun
customer_reviews.text: I can't say enough how great these are. My 3 year old absolutely loves these and they added onto the Tech Set by Quercetti and now we can do even more. The tech set is definitely geared toward older kids but my son and husband will play with these gears for and hour uninterrupted. And if you have a 3 year old you understand how that's a REALLY LONG TIME to hold their attention! I have now purchased this Kaleido Gears set as a gift for several friends and their little ones all with positive feedback!
customer_reviews.author: T-Fri

customer_reviews.title: The greatest toy ever!
customer_reviews.text: Appeals to all ages. Challenging, yet easy and adaptable. Appeals to all ages!
customer_reviews.author: cindy symmonds

customer_reviews.title: Weak plastic and tight fitting
customer_reviews.text: i like that the board can be seperated and re-shaped, but my 4 year old finds it difficult to push them all the way together. There are plastic pins on the bottom of the gears to hold them to the board, but they break easily. The spinning colors are just stickers that will wear off soon. Despite the fustration of lining up everything i like the idea of this toy. I encourage parents to interact and show how precise a geared machine must be to operate.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa B.

customer_reviews.title: Fun for a bit.
customer_reviews.text: We've enjoyed this toy, but it hasn't held their attention as long as I would have liked. My 4 year old is interested, but it is over quickly. I gave this a high rating because I think he will really love it in the near future when he can get more into the sophistication of the toy. My main issue is that the white pegs that hold the gears to the blocks bend and break easily. Georello sends many extras with the pack, so it's not too much of an issue yet. I would say a definite yes for kids around the ages of 5-6, especially builders!
customer_reviews.author: Virginia E. Farrell

customer_reviews.title: This set is perfect for the kid who is into the mechanics of ...
customer_reviews.text: This set is perfect for the kid who is into the mechanics of things. this one has different size gears and has the ability to create your own grid. my son loved it. He did get another set from a different brand and all the gears are the same size and you can create different designs such as a craling caterpillar etc. both sets are very neat and have different plus' just depends on what your needs are.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: Great Toy
customer_reviews.text: The child we gave this to as a gift loved this. It's such a great interactive toy and very classy. Will buy more for future gifts when needed.
customer_reviews.author: CS

customer_reviews.title: 2.5 year old LOVES it
customer_reviews.text: My little boy loves it. He cannot get enough of it. And now that he has pulled his grandpa and grandma into the action, so there is never a dull moment around this toy. It is well made and although he did struggle a little initially in attaching the gears to the base, he has gotten the hang of it. These days he is trying to stack the gears. Highly recommended for the mechanically inclined and not so mechanically inclined :).
customer_reviews.author: Shantanu Sharma

customer_reviews.title: the parts are easy to assemble and the quality is excellent
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old son loves this toy, the parts are easy to assemble and the quality is excellent
customer_reviews.author: Lnna

customer_reviews.title: Educational &  Fun Toy
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Quercetti Georello Kaleido Gears, 55 pieces for my grandsons 4th & 5th birthday. They love these gears! An endless number of patterns can be made with these gears encouraging childrens creativity. There is a handle that makes the brightly colored gears turn. My grandsons play with this toy for up to an hour at a time. This toy seems to be well made. It is made of a firm plastic but not the type that breaks easily. I would recommend Quercetti Georello Kaleido Gears for preschoolers through early elementary age children. A well made, educational fun toy.
customer_reviews.author: The Doctor & the Nana

customer_reviews.title: Very cool and fun
customer_reviews.text: Very cool and fun. Even my three year old can put them together and make designs. The only reason I didn't give them five stars is because the little pegs that hold them in place are quite flimsy. I don't see them lasting as long as the rest of the toy.
customer_reviews.author: J. Nilsson

customer_reviews.title: These toys are so fun for my boys
customer_reviews.text: These toys are so fun for my boys! Perfect for the mechanically-minded little engineer. However, the gears attach to the base with these little white anchor pieces, and the legs break off really easy! If only we could buy replace those anchor pieces! Without them it's hard to use the rest of the set.
customer_reviews.author: taco

customer_reviews.title: This is a pretty cool toy
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty cool toy. As expected, my children were extremely interested in making it work. My eight year old more so than my five year old, but I was surprised at how flimsy the plastic seems. I don't really know what I expected but it was just different than I could have imagined. I feel this will need to be played with kid gloves; the plastic is so soft it almost bends with a slight amount of pressure. Still fun, but it needs to be taken apart carefully after assembled to ensure the integrity of the toy.
customer_reviews.author: S. Shell

customer_reviews.title: the pieces will just be garbage right away
customer_reviews.text: Lots of little tiny pieces with this. I would not say this would work well for a 3-year-old. A more simple set with the gears that work without adding little plastic pieces would be ideal. I wouldn't give this to a child under 5 or 6, the pieces will just be garbage right away.
customer_reviews.author: MyOpinion

customer_reviews.title: and did the little boy ever squeal with delight! We also made a three dimensional "car"
customer_reviews.text: This is a quality toy! I only wish it had more parts! I may buy an extra box or two. We attached a drill bit to the "hub", started the drill, and did the little boy ever squeal with delight! We also made a three dimensional "car". I can see this toy being a great toy and learning tool for children of all ages. Highly recommend!!!
customer_reviews.author: young croney

customer_reviews.title: Came back for more
customer_reviews.text: This is actually the second set I purchased. The first one was for my 5 year old grandson, who is on the autism spectrum. He loved them, but so did his two younger siblings. They all wanted more gears! So, as a good Nana does, I purchased another set for the whole gang so they can be even more creative.
customer_reviews.author: Gracie

customer_reviews.title: Very worthwhile purchase.
customer_reviews.text: My 2-1/2 year old grandson likes it, although his father and grandfather probably like it even more. Promotes experimentation and creativity, from very simple 2- or 3-piece arrangements to complex, using all pieces. Insertion method is pretty ingenious (4 prong) so even the 11-month old can make an arrangement turn without wrecking it.
customer_reviews.author: derpbag

customer_reviews.title: purchased it for the 4 year old to work on ...
customer_reviews.text: purchased it for the 4 year old to work on his small motor skills but his little sister plays with it, she is 20 months old and enjoys putting it together and turning the handle. The soon to be 5 year old isn't as interested
customer_reviews.author: Mary Baz

customer_reviews.title: fun and educational
customer_reviews.text: ALL of us love playing with this toy. My 6 year old gets a little bored with it but my 3 year old and my husband love building with it. made of durable plastice, would be hard to break it, which is great for my 3 year old. The 3 year old does need a bit of help aligning the gears but he's starting to get the hang of it.
customer_reviews.author: me

customer_reviews.title: He enjoyed it but it don't hold his interest for long
customer_reviews.text: I bought this set for my son's fourth birthday. He enjoyed it but it don't hold his interest for long. The colors and designs are great but the gears don't always turn smoothly and the base is tough to put together.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa G.

customer_reviews.title: A+
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Awesome quality - especially for the price This was bought for our OT school based practice. Over joyed with this purchase and product outcome. A+
customer_reviews.author: Renee H Chewning

customer_reviews.title: Great for 1.5 yrs +
customer_reviews.text: My toddler loves it. You have to help her, but she gets really excited to build the gears and make them go. I can see this lasting for years. Keep in mind tho, we bring it out once a week. It isn't really an every day toy and it usually requires us playing with her. She tries to play it with her friends, but they don't get real far.
customer_reviews.author: The Real Kiley

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for all ages!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 4 year old grandson. I had to try it before giving it to him and it's a blast! He loves it and plays with it more than any of his other Christmas presents. Multiple sets would be even more fun. It allows the gears to be stacked, but it should allow them to be anchored such that you can make multi level gear-up or down chains. It's great fun and teaches mechanical relationships to young kids. It's well engineered and made! I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Stanley Hall

customer_reviews.title: Great Teaching Tool
customer_reviews.text: I used this for a presentation I was giving on Proposal Development. I wanted to illustrate how are the teams on a proposal had to work together to achieve success. It was a great ice breaker and the two teams I had were actually competing to see who could do a better job. And these are adults! Afterwards, I gave it to my grandchildren who enjoy it.
customer_reviews.author: Gail A. Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Makes a great rainy day project!
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old grand daughter wasn't too impressed when she opened this gift from me for her birthday. However, her mother said once everyone went home - she got involved and played with this for hours - needing a little help the first time for dad to understand that the gears must line up - she got great enjoyment out of it!
customer_reviews.author: C. Kuhn

customer_reviews.title: ... quality controll on packaging was lacking but product was good once cleaned my son loves planing with this I ...
customer_reviews.text: We'll made was a lot of little scrap plastic pieces in the package that were just leftovers from manufacfuring quality controll on packaging was lacking but product was good once cleaned my son loves planing with this I love the creativity this promotes
customer_reviews.author: Calljoec

customer_reviews.title: This is a very cool toy but some of the tiny pegs were already ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a very cool toy but some of the tiny pegs were already breaking off within 15 minutes of playing. Toddler toys should be indestructible!
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Go ahead and buy two- it's that awesome.
customer_reviews.text: Buy this toy, go ahead and buy two now because you will want to. We play with it with our one year old- building things for him and he does the spinning. Every kid who comes to our house is thrilled to play with it. We want to buy an expansion pack and keep on going.
customer_reviews.author: LeftHandedScissors

customer_reviews.title: One of the best toys ever purchased
customer_reviews.text: One of the best toys ever purchased! I first bought this toy for my daughter then for some of my her friends and to my niece and nephew and they all love it. Quercetti is a wonderful brand producing smart toys.
customer_reviews.author: Melina

customer_reviews.title: Bit tough for little hands to put together, but beautiful...
customer_reviews.text: The base pieces of this toy are a bit stiff for my kids' little hands to put together. Also, the pegs that hold the gears onto the base are a bit tricky, but will build good fine motor skills if not discarded in frustration. I was just as entranced by this toy as they were as we played with it together for the first time. The brightly colored decals are trippy and fun. And learning that gears transfer energy they supply to move other gears of various sizes "on down the line" is... priceless. *grin*
customer_reviews.author: Erin Ptacek

customer_reviews.title: The gears are durable and the colors are fun. The 55 piece set is a perfect size ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Quercetti gears for my son who has autism and is developmentally delayed. He absolutely loves this toy! We spend quality time together reconfiguring the gears into many different arrangements. The gears are durable and the colors are fun. The 55 piece set is a perfect size for the dining room table. I recommend this toy to any parent.
customer_reviews.author: D. Hoyle

customer_reviews.title: some of them were a little dirty and some of the stickers on the gears were ...
customer_reviews.text: It looks cheap, the pieces are just thrown inside the big box with not proper placing (like a cardboard structure for each size etc), some of them were a little dirty and some of the stickers on the gears were a little faded. I ordered it to give as a gift but I am embarrassed to give it, I ended up buying something else cause I didn't feel I can give this.
customer_reviews.author: Noa Heyne

customer_reviews.title: Educational, Brittle
customer_reviews.text: These gears are educational and fun,but they do break. My daughter loves it, but she has broken multiple pieces. They have small plastic pegs that break. Sometimes they will still work, but if too many break, they won't work anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie A. Baute

customer_reviews.title: Fun to figure out where to connect them so they ...
customer_reviews.text: These are very neat. Fun to figure out where to connect them so they all work together.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great gift
customer_reviews.text: I gave this to two three year olds for Christmas. They were thrilled and dove right into building. By the way, both were girls.This is a good toy for younger children. I wouldn't give it to younger than three or any age that still puts a lot of things in their mouth.
customer_reviews.author: sumogirl

customer_reviews.title: Fun for boys and girls!
customer_reviews.text: These gears are fun and durable. Two of our grandsons loved these gears when we purchased them a few years ago--the boys were four and six when they got them--so we've purchased another set for our three-year-old granddaughter, too!
customer_reviews.author: FL Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Cool toy for thinkers!
customer_reviews.text: Not as much fun as I thought it could be but kids love it and have better imaginations than I do so 5 stars from them!!
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: which is nice.
customer_reviews.text: My son loves these and the base is a soft plastic, which is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: Kaleido Gears!
customer_reviews.text: Nice toy......something different for the grandkids. Must use your imagination and its never the same thing twice! Would recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Grandma in Michigan

customer_reviews.title: Smart toy
customer_reviews.text: These are so much fun! The whole family loves to use them. They were purchased for our 2 year old who needs a little help with the spacing to make them work but she should be independent using them in the next few months. Keeps her attention for a long period of time and is a great "brain toy".
customer_reviews.author: Mrs Vegas

customer_reviews.title: A future classic toy:
customer_reviews.text: I love to play with these as much as my grandchildren! We have lots of fun together with this bright, challenging and always engaging toy. No noise, no batteries, no tiny parts to lose, just great imaginative play that stimulates perceptual motor skills.
customer_reviews.author: Bubie Malka

customer_reviews.title: Great with supervision
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 20 month old and i think I have more fun with it than he does! Its really cool. In this age group, it has to be used with supervision as there are small parts, but i will be a good toy for him to grow with. I would def buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Mama Link

customer_reviews.title: Techie Grandpa had fun with these too
customer_reviews.text: A lot of fun arranging colorful gears as introduction to things mechanical for 4-6 year old. Some gears can be layered to create bi-directional movements.
customer_reviews.author: Rialbo

customer_reviews.title: Fun, well made, full of possibilities!
customer_reviews.text: This is just so fun and colorful and full of possibilities. It's well made and gives lots of room for creativity.
customer_reviews.author: Penny Anast

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: my baby has been playing with it since he was 10 month old. He loves anything that spins and this toy is amazing! I can't wait until he is old enough to start doing the complex layouts
customer_reviews.author: Martha

customer_reviews.title: Fun for everone!!
customer_reviews.text: Great toy. Lots of fun!! Different every time you play. Got this for our little autistic guy. Big Hit.
customer_reviews.author: gets annoying

customer_reviews.title: A little flimsy
customer_reviews.text: I love the gears and the ability to place the gears in several different places on each tile, but the tiles themselves are hollow and a little flimsier than I would have liked. When assembling the base it tended to shift or fall apart easily.
customer_reviews.author: Notrab Drahcir

customer_reviews.title: 4 year olds
customer_reviews.text: the kids got it right away and spend a lot of time with it I have to supervise to prevent the connector pins from breaking could use more pieces and another crank wish I could buy replacement parts, so giving it 4 stars
customer_reviews.author: milleb

customer_reviews.title: Fun and interactive toy that was immediately a hit on ...
customer_reviews.text: Fun and interactive toy that was immediately a hit on a busy Christmas morning. It was a gift for a 4 year old boy and he was able to figure it out almost immediately without my supervision. BIG HIT, HIGHLY RECOMMEND.
customer_reviews.author: L. Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Execellent toy
customer_reviews.text: This is so creative and well made - it is one of my favorite gifts to my grandchild. All of us love playing with this toy. It was well packaged - as well as the shipping packaging. It arrived on time in great condition.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce R.

customer_reviews.title: Great Gear Toy!!
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought this toy for my son Jacob who is four and Autistic,He really likes this toy although I can't keep it together long enough for him to really see all of them working. I'm just glad he plays with it! I would buy from them again!! Thank You!! Heidi Van Oss
customer_reviews.author: Heidi Vanoss

customer_reviews.title: Love the Gears
customer_reviews.text: The gears work very well. I also have the magnetic version which comes on a magnetic board - it is much easier ofr 3 year old to play with than this verson; but, this one is "fun" when a grown-up helps set it up.
customer_reviews.author: tingleafk

customer_reviews.title: Quercetti gear set
customer_reviews.text: My grandson loves to create working machines with these gears. He can turn the crank to make all the gears, he has assembled, move. It is very good quality and great for the creative mind.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis A. Widman

customer_reviews.title: Not so good
customer_reviews.text: Except placing different wheels, there is nothing much kid can do or think of. Only helps in understanding how gear system works, but for that its not worth spending money.
customer_reviews.author: Mihir

customer_reviews.title: The bee's knees
customer_reviews.text: My 3-year-old toddler got a full year of fun with these gears. She hasn't managed to break them, they're mostly gone because she misplaced them.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Twain

customer_reviews.title: cool idea.
customer_reviews.text: my son was too young but I got it anyway. I put it togther and he spins them... cool idea.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Neat product, something out of the usual play toy.
customer_reviews.text: 2 and 4 year old grandsons like this product. 2 year old needs adult help with it, but 4 year old has figured it out. Gears are a little hard to separate at first, but with practice the little hands can do it.Holds their attention
customer_reviews.author: Mrs L.

customer_reviews.title: Fun, but limited things to do with them
customer_reviews.text: Little children may have trouble figuring out how to work these, but with a bit of help will enjoy them. They aren't very versatile, but are interesting for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Onymous

customer_reviews.title: Our older grandson loved these gears.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this because of the ablility for our grandchildren to be creative and learn about how things work. We bought it for the 3 and 4 year old but our 9 year old grandson loved it and was enjoying it also. We hope to expand the basic set with additional pieces in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Great for multiple ages
customer_reviews.text: All 4 kids loved this!! Perfect addition to our homeschool classroom!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Engaging
customer_reviews.text: Not quite enough gears, but holds the Littles interest well
customer_reviews.author: Melinda

customer_reviews.title: Bright Colorful Educational!
customer_reviews.text: fantastic educational tool. babies like watching the gears as the develop hand/eye coordination and my seven year old is still enjoying the unlimited possibilities
customer_reviews.author: Anne Strayer

customer_reviews.title: very well built but looses it fun factor very quickly for my kids
customer_reviews.text: very cute, very well built but looses it fun factor very quickly for my kids.
customer_reviews.author: OneHungLow

customer_reviews.title: great toy
customer_reviews.text: Helps develop spatial perception and fine motorics. It presents right amount of challenge: the child has to put some effort into assembling, but not enough to discourage him/her. The pieces are of the right size too.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: FUN !!
customer_reviews.text: My 19 month old toddler loves this toy. His favorite he spends a lot of time spinning the gears and changing them. HE LOVES IT . I'm very happy i decided to purchase this instead of tomy gearation...these gears are soo much fun!
customer_reviews.author: jenmomm

customer_reviews.title: It's just OK...
customer_reviews.text: My kids had a similar gear toy when they were little and loved it for years, so I thought grandkids would enjoy this toy. These gears are smaller, less substantial and of lesser quality than I expected... but still acceptable for the price. I think the grandkids will enjoy playing with the toy, which is important.
customer_reviews.author: a

customer_reviews.title: Creative toy
customer_reviews.text: This is a great toy, and now my go-to for 3-4 year old kids' birthdays. I tend to avoid plastic, definitely avoid toys with batteries and make noise, but this is a high-quality, creative toy, and II've been impressed with what the kids can do with it.
customer_reviews.author: gyea

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very nice gear set with soft plastic material that is easy on the hands and does not break easily.
customer_reviews.author: Sweet Pea

customer_reviews.title: great fun
customer_reviews.text: My grandsons love it. very nice quality. Easy to assemble. Only drawback is large white backing doesn't lock together so kiddos cannot pick it up. Still loads of fun
customer_reviews.author: Vero

customer_reviews.title: I accidentally bought these on a deal and thought my ...
customer_reviews.text: I accidentally bought these on a deal and thought my 6 year would be too old for them - nope! He LOVES this!!!
customer_reviews.author: M.Rait

customer_reviews.title: Great toy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this toy for my son for Christmas. He gets lots of the same type of toy so I was glad to find something that would help him use his brain too. This is made very well and my three year old picked up the concept quickly. You could even buy more than one set for extended building. I love this type of toy.
customer_reviews.author: Janelle

customer_reviews.title: Mesmerizing and really fun. Keeps the kids busy for hours (me too)
customer_reviews.text: Mesmerizing and really fun. Keeps the kids busy for hours (me too)
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Keeps my 4 year old daughter entertained. And helps her learn cause and effect at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Sol McNally

customer_reviews.title: Building Gears with Grandpapa
customer_reviews.text: My 2.5 year old granddaughter gets a kick out of playing with these with her Grandpapa. But like most things it doesn't keep her attention for long. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Sara_Snow

customer_reviews.title: Good fun!
customer_reviews.text: Saw my 3 year old great niece open and immediately begin playing with this gift. She needed a little help from her Dad but quickly got the hang of it. Nailed the Christmas gift!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa T. Shearer

customer_reviews.title: Great toy. Made in Italy.
customer_reviews.text: Great toy! We constructed a truck using the gears as wheels. The pieces are made from soft, smooth plastic, which feels nice in hand. Considering buying more Quercetti products now.
customer_reviews.author: Andy M.

customer_reviews.title: My 2 years old grandson received this for Christmas!
customer_reviews.text: My two euro grandson received this Christmas! He has not stopped playing with it! We will definitely be adding more sets to the collection.
customer_reviews.author: MiMi

customer_reviews.title: best toy ever
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 5 year old and he loves it. He makes all different 2D shapes and 3D as well - each one is different. Simple, colorful, well designed and well constructed.
customer_reviews.author: Ocean Engineer

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: This is a great toy. I bought it for my 2 year old child that loves technical things. Toys usually bore him. We build it together, and then he has a blast making the pieces go round and round. I recommend it for any child that is bored by normal 2 year old toys.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie L. Pelkey

customer_reviews.title: Good Gears
customer_reviews.text: Gears were purchased for a special needs child to be mounted on an activity wall. They are nice and bright and keep a child attending to task. Would recommend
customer_reviews.author: Kristy Germann

customer_reviews.title: Fun Fun Fun
customer_reviews.text: Got these for another grandson. He loved them so decided to buy another set for a different little guy. Can't wait to give them to him.
customer_reviews.author: gram of 5

customer_reviews.title: Interesting toy
customer_reviews.text: Great toy but at first needs a little adult participation for my 3 year old grandson who had a little difficulty with some of the pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Willie P

customer_reviews.title: Great toy!
customer_reviews.text: I was actually going to return this without opening it but my kids found it and wanted to open it. To my surprise, I quickly had 5 kids ages 3-8 playing with this toy! Great toy!
customer_reviews.author: James Lindstrom

customer_reviews.title: Purposeful gift!
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my grandson who is autistic. The whole family loves it!!!! Please consider this for all children.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Newman

customer_reviews.title: Gears
customer_reviews.text: Great toy. My grandchildren will love it. I need to find a good container for them. Wish they were magnets for the fridge.
customer_reviews.author: connie oberly

customer_reviews.title: too complicated for many kids
customer_reviews.text: This toy looks like fun but is very frustrating for the kids with whom I work. First it requires that you put the base together which is quite difficult for little hands. Then you have to put the gears on the top and that requires advanced planning that is far too advanced for little ones until they are well into elementary school. I presented it to several different kids of different ages and stages and it was not something that any asked to try again.
customer_reviews.author: Avid reader

product_meta.title: Quercetti Kaleido Gears - 55 Piece Building Set with 3 Different Sized Gears
product_meta.description:
Even young children will delight in figuring out how to put the pieces together and attach the gears creatively and independently. The 6 largest gears have stickers that make captivating designs as they spin. The square base pieces interlock easily to form flat or 3D structures. You can even make a gear box! Create your base, then insert axles and connect gears so that they rotate at the same time. Finally, turn the crank to start a spectacular chain reaction and watch the beautiful visual effects. Kaleido Gears construction set provides hours of fun while introducing children to basic principles of mechanics. This simple yet highly educational toy is great to encourage your child’s creative skills, hand-eye coordination, and develop fine motor skills and hand dexterity. Start your child’s artistic development early with the Quercetti Kaleido Gears. Quercetti toys are designed for children ages 3 to 12 to encourage reasoning, stimulate creativity and hone physical skills. Quercetti toys span a wide range of categories and stages, from early skill builders to craft activities, pure educational products to advanced construction sets. Package contains (1) Quercetti Kaleido Gears. Includes 6 large gears, 6 stickers, 1 crank, 22 white axles, 6 small gears, 4 middle gears and 16 interlocking plates. Largest Gear is 4.5" in diameter. Recommended for children aged 3-7.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
With 60 years of experience creating educational toys, Quercetti has contributed to generations of children engaging in beneficial play that encourages creativity and stimulates intuitive reasoning. Kaleido Gears construction set provides hours of great fun while introducing children to some basic principles of mechanics. Try all possible combinations to make a base with the interlocking plates, and then insert axles and connect gears so that they rotate at the same time. Finally, turn the crank to start a spectacular chain reaction and watch the beautiful visual effects. Each gear is decorated with a different design that stimulates colour perception and creativity. Kaleido Gears is made of durable and washable plastic that is both safe and unbreakable. For ages 3 years and up. Contents: - 16 interlocking plates - 6 large gears - 4 middle gears - 6 small gears - 22 white axles - 1 crank - 6 stickers
feature_bullets: CAPTIVATING DESIGNS: Even young children will delight in figuring out how to put the pieces together and attach the gears creatively and independently. The 6 largest gears have stickers that make captivating designs as they spin. The square base pieces interlock easily to form flat or 3D structures. You can even make a gear box!

CRANK UP THE FUN: Create your base, then insert axles and connect gears so that they rotate at the same time. Finally, turn the crank to start a spectacular chain reaction and watch the beautiful visual effects. Kaleido Gears construction set provides hours of fun while introducing children to basic principles of mechanics.

LEARN AT PLAY: This simple yet highly educational toy is great to encourage your child’s creative skills, hand-eye coordination, and develop fine motor skills and hand dexterity. Start your child’s artistic development early with the Quercetti Kaleido Gears.

INTELLIGENT TOYS: Quercetti toys are designed for children ages 3 to 12 to encourage reasoning, stimulate creativity and hone physical skills. Quercetti toys span a wide range of categories and stages, from early skill builders to craft activities, pure educational products to advanced construction sets.

PRODUCT SPECIFICATIONS: Package contains (1) Quercetti Kaleido Gears. Includes 6 large gears, 6 stickers, 1 crank, 22 white axles, 6 small gears, 4 middle gears and 16 interlocking plates. Largest Gear is 4.5" in diameter. Recommended for children aged 3-7.
